meanings.definition: A person who watches or notices something.
meanings.sent1: The observer saw a shooting star in the night sky.
meanings.sent2: The wildlife observer spotted a rare bird in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The observer noticed a squirrel doing cartwheels in the park.
meanings.sent4: The observer's eyes were like cameras capturing every detail.
meanings.sent5: The observer's keen gaze never missed a thing.

meanings.definition: A person who attends or is present at an event.
meanings.sent1: The observer clapped enthusiastically at the end of the play.
meanings.sent2: The sports observer cheered for their favorite team during the game.
meanings.sent3: The observer at the party danced like nobody was watching.
meanings.sent4: The observer stood out in the crowd like a bright light.
meanings.sent5: The observer's presence added to the excitement of the event.

meanings.definition: A device or instrument used to observe or monitor something.
meanings.sent1: The weather observer recorded the temperature every hour.
meanings.sent2: The security observer alerted the authorities of any suspicious activity.
meanings.sent3: The observer beeped loudly when the cake was ready in the oven.
meanings.sent4: The observer hummed softly as it scanned the surroundings.
meanings.sent5: The observer's screen displayed real-time data for analysis.
